topic.title: How to Add a Line Under the Header

indexterm.product: author developer editor authorEclipse developerEclipse editorEclipse

body.p: There are two ways to add a horizontal line under the header.

section.title: Method 1: Add a Border in the Page Margin Boxes
section.p: To add a horizontal line that would stretch across the width of the page, add a bottom border to each of the 5 margin boxes in the top side of the page (top-left-corner, top-left, top-center, top-right, top-right-corner).

p.note: The padding-top: 1em; is used to avoid the border at the bottom of the header that joins with the page content.

section.title: Method 2: Use a Background Image
section.p: An alternative method is to add a horizontal line/border under an existing header (or in any other part of the page) using an SVG image, as described in .
